publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3990 Irene McGugan: Nursery Nurses—That the Parliament notes that there are 7,500 nursery nurses working in Scotland's nursery schools, day nurseries and special schools who are paid different rates in different establishments in different parts of the country; further notes that these nursery nurses have been campaigning for two years for a review of their status and pay in order to establish a formal career structure and a national pay agreement in recognition of their important role in the education service, and urges all parties involved in these negotiations to bring about an early resolution to this issue.
S1M-3990 Nursery Nurses (lodged on 5 March 2003) Fiona Hyslop*

S1M-3990 Irene McGugan: Nursery Nurses-That the Parliament notes that there are 7,500 nursery nurses working in Scotland's nursery schools, day nurseries and special schools who are paid different rates in different establishments in different parts of the country; further notes that these nursery nurses have been campaigning for two years for a review of their status and pay in order to establish a formal career structure and a national pay agreement in recognition of their important role in the education service, and urges all parties involved in these negotiations to bring about an early resolution to this issue. Supported by: Fiona Hyslop
S1M-3990 Nursery Nurses (lodged on 5 March 2003) Shona Robison*
S1M-3990 Nursery Nurses (lodged on 5 March 2003) Alex Neil*, Christine Grahame*
S1M-3990 Nursery Nurses (lodged on 5 March 2003) Donald Gorrie*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Kay Ullrich*, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-3990 Nursery Nurses (lodged on 5 March 2003) Michael Russell*
S1M-3990 Nursery Nurses (lodged on 5 March 2003) Andrew Wilson*
S1M-3990 Nursery Nurses (lodged on 5 March 2003) Ms Sandra White*
S1M-3990 Nursery Nurses (lodged on 5 March 2003) Mr Andrew Welsh*

S1M-3990 Irene McGugan: Nursery Nurses—That the Parliament notes that there are 7,500 nursery nurses working in Scotland's nursery schools, day nurseries and special schools who are paid different rates in different establishments in different parts of the country; further notes that these nursery nurses have been campaigning for two years for a review of their status and pay in order to establish a formal career structure and a national pay agreement in recognition of their important role in the education service, and urges all parties involved in these negotiations to bring about an early resolution to this issue. Supported by: Fiona Hyslop, Shona Robison, Alex Neil, Christine Grahame, Donald Gorrie, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Kay Ullrich, Tommy Sheridan, Michael Russell, Andrew Wilson, Ms Sandra White, Mr Andrew Welsh
